item.description: I want to give a special shout-out to the real gucci gang that came to office hours last week and helped out with the planning to make the club interesting.

item.title: we_have_returned
item.author: citysec@protonmail.com (Chantelle)
item.description: We did a test trial last semester to weigh in on the interest in security. It was mostly during the evenings that we kept our meetings BUT, back by popular demand, we are having our meetings on Thursdays during club hours üéâ

item.title: meeting_01
item.author: citysec@protonmail.com (Chantelle)
item.description: Meeting 1 Recap üéâ We started out by covering some pros & cons for different linux distros. The main ideas were that Ubuntu is a great daily driver while still learning the nuances of linux. Ubuntu allows you to explore the depths of linux while still offering a safe haven to return to when things get scary. üò± It may be tempting to jump straight into Arch or Kali linux when practicing web security, but it’s more important to use your new favorite OS as your default computer and not as a specialty app that you just need for some wifi cracking.

item.author: citysec@protonmail.com (Chantelle)
item.description: what we be about citySec was formed in the summer of 2018 to provide an ongoing outlet for the growing cybersecurity demand and presence at City College. citySec is a collective of cybersecurity enthusiasts. üíª citySec is for everyone. üë• citySec is fun… üé° so have fun with it! üéâ slack Join our slack channel to ask questions or discuss whatever it is you wish to talk about. We’ll respond!

item.title: events

item.description: hack with us General Body Meetings (Steinman Hall 2M5-2) Thursday, February 7 Thursday, March 21 Thursday, May 2 Club Office hours (Shepherd Hall 277) Thursdays 12:30p - 1:45p There's no office hours on Thursday March 7 Collegiate Competitions National Collegiate Penetration Testing Competition National Cyber League (CTF) Global Cyberlympics National Collegiate Cyber Defense Competition MITRE Cyber Academy (CTF) Panoply (NetSec) NYU’s CSAW (CTF) all other competitions can be found here hack with the community nyc chapter meetings 2600 Empire Hacking NYSEC New York CryptoParty Network DEFCON201 NCC Group Security Forum conferences (presentations are recorded and published on YouTube) HOPE BSidesNYC SummerCon CSAW * free THOTCon * got a great deal for students hackerspaces NYC Resistor Fat Cat Fab Lab Hack Manhattan

item.title: team projects
item.author: citysec@protonmail.com (Chantelle)
item.description: ** If you have a project you wish to advertise for collaboration, email us at citysec@protonmail.com and we’ll add you to the list! join a team, push some code, and hack: NetSec AppSec Operating Systems (kernel-level and user-level) Hardware Hacking Reverse Engineering Malware Analysis Cryptography Open Source Red Team vs. Blue team
